content.rendered:
What is PRP?

Platelet rich plasma (PRP) is nothing but concentrated blood plasma which contains a much higher number of platelets as compared to normal blood. It also contains vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), platelet derived growth factor (PDGF) and numerous other growth factors and peptides that lead to rapid wound healing and hair re-growth.

Get appointment
Call us 96501 44438

What is the procedure of PRP?

The procedure involves the application of numbing cream initially for half an hour. During this period 10 ml of your blood is collected and centrifuged at pre-determined settings. This process of centrifugation separates the other components of the blood from the platelets. The final result is a rich concentrate of platelets and growth factors within the plasma. This concentrate is then injected into the skin using fine needles at the level of the collagen.

How does PRP work for the face?

Platelet rich plasma therapy has a high concentration of platelets which leads to formation and release of growth factors that promote collagen regeneration underneath the skin. Due to this new collagen the skin looks healthier and younger. It improves fine lines. Wrinkles and various other signs of skin aging. Works on the texture of the skin and makes it tighter and more supple. When combine with micro needling it is a great treatment for acne scars.

How soon are results of PRP visible?

The results develop gradually over a few weeks to months.

Is PRP safe?

Since the entire procedure is based on utilising your own plasma, it is considered to be the safest anti-aging procedure.

How many sessions would be needed to see results?

A minimum of 3-4 sessions are needed to show results.

How long to PRP results last?

The skin rejuvenation results last for at least 12-18 months.

Can PRP be combined with other treatments?

Yes, PRP can be combined with your other anti-aging procedures like dermal fillers, botox, threads, photo facials, Clear lift etc.

Get appointment
Call us 9667684409
